item.title: Ann add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Read the best books first, or you may not have a chance to read them at all." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Ann add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Books are for people who wish they were somewhere else." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ann add a quote by Horace Mann
item.description: "A house without books is like a room without windows." -- Horace Mann

item.title: Ann add a quote by Linda Grayson
item.description: "There is nothing better than a friend, unless it is a friend with chocolate." -- Linda Grayson

item.title: Ann add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Ann add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Ann add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "Tact is the ability to tell someone to go to hell in such a way that they look forward to the trip." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Ann add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Ann add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "You forget what you want to remember, and you remember what you want to forget." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Ann add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "Right now I’m having amnesia and déjà vu at the same time. I think I’ve forgotten this before." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Ann add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Ann add a quote by Dennis Lehane
item.description: "Her forehead was unlined in the way of the recently embalmed and her smile resembled that of someone undergoing electroshock." -- Dennis Lehane

item.title: Ann add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do one thing every day that scares you." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Ann add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You wouldn't worry so much about what others think of you if you realized how seldom they do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Ann add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "She was clean": no piercings, tattoos, or scarifications. All the kids were now. And who could blame them, Alex thought, after watching three generations of flaccid tattoos droop like moth-eaten upholstery over poorly stuffed biceps and saggy asses?" -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: Ann add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Summer afternoon—summer afternoon; to me those have always been the two most beautiful words in the English language." -- Henry James

item.title: Ann add a quote by Amor Towles
item.description: "Slurring is the cursive of speech..." -- Amor Towles

item.title: Ann add a quote by Norton Juster
item.description: "Expect everything, I always say, and the unexpected never happens." -- Norton Juster

item.title: Ann add a quote by Nora Ephron
item.description: "…the amount of maintenance involving hair is genuinely overwhelming. Sometimes I think that not having to worry about your hair anymore is the secret upside of death." -- Nora Ephron

item.title: Ann add a quote by Paul Murray
item.description: "Gradually the awful truth dawns on you: that Santa Claus was just the tip of the iceberg - that your future will not be the rollercoaster ride you'd imagined, that the world occupied by your parents, the world of washing the dishes, going to the dentist, weekend trips to the DIY superstore to buy floor tiles, is actually largely what people mean when they speak of 'life'." -- Paul Murray

item.title: Ann add a quote by Paul Murray
item.description: "Never frown even when ur sad, coz u never know whose falling in love with ur smile!" -- Paul Murray

item.title: Ann add a quote by Paul Murray
item.description: "Life makes fools of all of us sooner or later. But keep your sense of humor and you'll at least be able to take your humiliations with some measure of grace. In the end, you know, its our own expectations that crush us." -- Paul Murray

item.title: Ann add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "Sleep is like a cat: It only comes to you if you ignore it." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Ann add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "Friends see most of each other’s flaws. Spouses see every awful last bit." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Ann add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "There's no app for a bourbon buzz on a warm day in a cool, dark bar. The world will always want a drink." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Ann add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "That wasn't any act of God. That was an act of pure human fuckery." -- Stephen King

item.title: Ann add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Our life is frittered away by detail. Simplify, simplify." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Ann add a quote by Nora Ephron
item.description: "When your children are teenagers, it's important to have a dog so that someone in the house is happy to see you." -- Nora Ephron

item.title: Ann add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The difference between genius and stupidity is; genius has its limits." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Ann add a quote by Brad Paisley
item.description: "Tomorrow, is the first blank page of a 365 page book. Write a good one." -- Brad Paisley
